title: gigDID
description: アタラプリズムをマススケールで採用するためには、最大かつ最も成長している労働力に到達しなければなりません。

f6_assessments.q0:
There is no real plan in this proposal on what will be delivered or how it will be delivered.
QUASAR has proposed or co-proposed a number of other project with little details and/or funding requests such as:
Pharo ACM - $1
dRisk - $5
Proof of Insurance - no details
communitybond.io Integrate- no details
Community Bond -Loyalty Rewards - no details
Community Bond - Metadata - no details
Trade Finance and Credit Insurance - minimal details
Endangered Language Preservation - no details
Locating Culture - no details
NAGchi - no details
NAGchi Cares - no details
f6_assessments.q1: Please provide a plan so that it can be evaluated. As it stands, there is not plan so it cannot be implemented successfully. Given the widely varying experience quoted for QUASAR in all the other proposal submitted, some evidence should be provided.
f6_assessments.q2: No clear deliverables have been mentioned thus making it hard to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Problem statement is not a problem statement - it is sort of a goal for Cardanao:
_"Atala PRISM must reach the largest and fastest growing labor force for MASS SCALE adoption."_
The Solution statement is not a solution it is more of an action plan.
_"*Describe your solution to the problem*"_
_"We will begin by implementing a combination of the sidetree protocol, which Microsoft ION and PRISM use, w/emphasis on required credentials."_

The explanation of Relevant experience is vague and not supported by either of the two the co-proposers' identities.
_"Senior Engineers, AWS, Enterprise Tech/Systems, Risk Narratives."_ Gig/Platform/Marketplace professional with a deep knowledge of processes.

The Webpage  listed has little to noting to do with the topic of the proposal https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2021/05/what-gig-economy-workers/
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the team has nothing to do with development of the platform that they predict can substitute for established IRS Tax preparation platforms like quicken or `turbo tax. The proposal gives no indication of how they approach custom acquisition, nor any indication  of a business plan. Will the objective of this proposal be implemented by a company? No indication of how much the proposers expect it will require in funding to reach sustainability. nor how they plan to get that funding.
f6_assessments.q2: In general the proposal is unfocused and lacking details that would enable auditing success and progress, Overall there is little to any indication of the steps that must be taken to build out the tech than will deliver the service that is (very sketchily described)  to be developed to create the product that will be offered to 60M people filing tax reports to the US Government. The objective of having "background in onboarding services by 12/15/2021 suggests that the team will outsource the core of their proposal and does not address a plan for creation of the platform itself, so as such, not auditable. It seems the target users are "contractors" without explaining what a "contractor" is.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal did not highlight a problem but proposed a solution.
The Problem statement of this proposal is problematic because it did not highlight a problem but made a declaration ("Atala PRISM must reach the largest and fastest growing labor force for MASS SCALE adoption.").
The Solution to the "Declaration" lacks details but instead were replaced with "Action Plan", "Performance Metrics"(Listed twice with different content),"Skills Required" etc.
This proposal will go a long way if a proper problem statement is presented, a well detailed solution was proposed and a more clearer implementation plan with cost breakdown/implications.

I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q1:
No verifiable links with given experience was provided and no implementation plan.

I strongly disagree
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal did not provide sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal solution.

I strongly disagree.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem statement aligns with the challenge although the overall wording, particularly the word "must", could be improved. The solution description should be much more clearly defined.
The goal of providing 1099 tax forms does not align with the challenge objective. The proposal intent is probably to use DID to provide this service in which case this would align however as written the proposal offers no details on how it intends to achieve it's goals including how it utilizes DID. 
The proposal is not able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users despite having a target market of 60 million people since it does not define how the solution uses DID.
The proposer should look at other winning proposals to see examples of expectations in terms of solution descriptions or team up with someone with proposal writing experience.
Based upon my experience, I disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has not provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links.
The team has not been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal. Team member descriptions should focus on skills relevant to the proposal.
The budget is not reasonable to achieve the goals mainly because it is difficult to determine what the goals are based upon the proposal.
The timetable is not realistic to complete the work and does not show what is being done and when.
The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal.
The proposal does not identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation.
Based upon my experience, I disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with a single milestone on a specific date. 
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user.  The proposal does suggest alternative performance metrics.
The proposal should detail specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals.
It is difficult to audit without knowing what the solution is supposed to be. Reading between the lines, my best understanding is that the proposal is for a website that companies can use to dispense 1099 tax forms to contractors probably using DIDs in some way with the website going live on 12/15/2021 which would be an auditable event.
Based upon my experience, I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: While getting DIDs to people is a great project, this proposal lacks structure and coherence and is firmulated quite confusing.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is half-heartedly made and confusing. Especially in the lightthat the same proposer has published several proposals that do not fulfill any formal requirements I would advice voting against this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones and metrics are too brief and confusing. Especially in the light that the same proposer has published several proposals that do not fulfill any formal requirements I would advice voting against this proposal

solution: まずは、Microsoft IONやPRISMが採用しているサイドツリープロトコルと、必要な認証情報を組み合わせて実装していきます。
experience: シニア・エンジニア、AWS、エンタープライズ・テック／システム、リスク・ナラティブ。プロセスを熟知したGig/Platform/Marketplaceのプロフェッショナル。
